senses.de: To make something impossible or prevent it from happening, usually by doing something else
senses.ex: The fact that she's moving to France precludes the possibility of us living together.

Tips.title: Irreversible Prevention
Tips.description: Preclude often implies a permanent or definitive prevention of something happening.
Tips.example: The judge's ruling precludes any future claims of ownership.

Tips.title: Not Immediate
Tips.description: Preclude doesn't mean to stop something instantly; it sets conditions that prevent future occurrences.
Tips.example: Building a fence around the garden precludes deer from entering.

Tips.title: Academic Tone
Tips.description: The word 'preclude' is often used in formal or academic contexts, rather than casual speech.
Tips.example: The research precludes the possibility of a chemical reaction in such conditions.

senses.de: To prevent someone from doing something or to not allow something
senses.ex: I believe these new rules will preclude people from expressing their opinions freely.

Tips.title: Active Obstruction
Tips.description: When precluding someone, it implies that an action has been taken to actively prevent their participation or access.
Tips.example: The club's policies preclude anyone under 18 from joining.

Tips.title: Exclusion by Criteria
Tips.description: Preclude can indicate that certain criteria or rules systemically exclude certain groups or actions.
Tips.example: The height requirement precludes many people from riding the roller coaster.

senses.ex: His criminal record precludes him from becoming a teacher.

Tips.title: Legal Consequences
Tips.description: In legal contexts, 'preclude' suggests that a law or regulation prevents certain actions or events legally.
Tips.example: His prior convictions preclude him from owning a firearm.

Tips.title: Formal Prerequisite
Tips.description: Preclude is often used in formal situations to express that not meeting certain conditions makes something else impossible.
Tips.example: Lack of evidence precludes a conviction in this case.

Tips.title: Unintended Effects
Tips.description: Sometimes, 'preclude' is used to express how one event inadvertently prevents another due to its effects.
Tips.example: The unexpected road closure precluded their timely arrival at the concert.

Bar.wordDefinition:
Bar means to block or prevent something from happening, like a door that is barred to keep people out. Preclude means to prevent or make something impossible, like a broken leg precluding you from running in a race.

Both words are used to describe preventing something from happening, but bar tends to be used for physical objects or obstacles while preclude tends to be used for more abstract or intangible things, like opportunities, options, or possibilities.

For example, you might say "the locked gate barred our entry to the park" or "bad weather precluded us from going to the beach."

Exclude.wordDefinition:
Exclude means to keep something or someone out intentionally or by choice. For example, "I excluded her from the party because she wasn't invited.".

In simpler terms, exclude means to leave something or someone out intentionally or willingly, while preclude means to make something impossible or prevent it from happening in advance.

Hinder.wordDefinition:
Hinder means to make it difficult for someone to do something. For example, if someone puts obstacles in your way, they hinder your progress.

Hinder makes something hard to do, while preclude makes it impossible. Both words are used to describe situations where something is getting in the way of another task, but hinder means that it's just more difficult, while preclude means it's not possible at all.

Impede.wordDefinition:
Both impede and preclude mean to hinder or prevent something from happening.

Impede means to slow down or obstruct progress or movement. For example, if there is heavy traffic on the road, it can impede your journey and delay your arrival.

Impede means to slow down, while preclude means to prevent entirely.

Obstruct.wordDefinition:
Obstruct means to block or hinder progress, movement or passage.

It is often used to describe physical barriers or obstacles that impede the path of something or someone. For example, a fallen tree obstructs a road or a broken lock obstructs the opening of a door.

It is not necessarily a physical obstruction, but rather a situation or circumstance that makes something unlikely or impossible to occur.

Obstruct refers to physical barriers while preclude refers to circumstances or situations that prevent something from happening.

Prevent.wordDefinition:
Prevent means to stop something from happening before it actually happens. For example, wearing a seatbelt can prevent injuries in a car accident.

Preclude means to eliminate the possibility of something happening beforehand, while prevent means to stop something from happening altogether.

Prohibit.wordDefinition:
Prohibit means to not allow something or to make something illegal. For example, smoking is prohibited in some public areas.

Preclude means to stop something from happening while prohibit means to not allow it to happen in the first place. Preclude is more about preventing the possibility of something happening while prohibit is more about stopping something that is already happening.

Stop.wordDefinition:
Stop means to put an end to something that is already happening. It involves taking action to halt a current process or behavior.

For example, pressing the break pedal will stop a car that is already moving.

Preclude is used to prevent something from happening before it starts, while stop is used to put an end to something that is already happening.

videos.Text: In the physical world, ownership actually fences people out. It precludes others from enjoying what you own. I wouldn't expect to feel welcome in your home uninvited. Digital space, however, is expansive. It's home to the infinite, the exponential,
videos.Title: Kayvon Tehranian: How...

videos.Text: that we're on the cusp of change that may be optimistic and maybe every generation believes they're on the cusp of change we certainly still live in a time where a misstep could preclude our
videos.Title: Let's Talk About Clean...

quotes.Text: Sometimes you're encouraged, and other times disappointed. It's a matter of going in and precluding all that with, 'This is what I do, not who I am.' I need to be who I am in the process of doing what I do. I need to stay true to what it is I'm really here for. And that's the hardest thing, the biggest challenge.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Craig T. Nelson

quotes.Text: I don't think there's any reason in journalism not to approach stories we cover with humility, empathy, compassion, and intellectual openness. I mean, I think those are just important human traits. I don't think that precludes scrutiny, negativity, where it's appropriate.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: David Gregory

quotes.Text: The children who are 'our future' will inherit a world created not just by parental devotion but by the sort of zealous, focused endeavors that can preclude good parenting.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Virginia Postrel

quotes.Text: There is no physical law precluding particles from being organised in ways that perform even more advanced computations than the arrangements of particles in human brains.
quotes.Title: English Physicist
quotes.Name: Stephen Hawking

quotes.Text: The Ranbaxy acquisition doesn't preclude us from making more large acquisitions. The important issue is whether we have the management bandwidth to handle the acquisition.
quotes.Title: Indian Businessman
quotes.Name: Dilip Shanghvi

quotes.Text: Liberalism does not preclude an organisation of the flow of money in which some channels are used in decision making while others are only good for the payment of debts.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Jean-Francois Lyotard

quotes.Text: At least I have precluded the possibility of peaking too early.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: George McGovern

quotes.Text: My impression is that the NBA always precluded anything else.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: John Stockton

quotes.Text: Relationships do not preclude issues of morality.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Jhumpa Lahiri

quotes.Text: Diversity does not preclude political stability.
quotes.Title: German Economist
quotes.Name: Klaus Schwab
